title: Laptop issue. Game's fps freezes randomly. Maintains a high 140 fps otherwise.
body:
Hey guys I'm currently on vacation so I decided to take my handy Lenovo Y50 which is a couple of years old now.
I realized the laptop didn't have much important files on there so I just decided to reformat it entirely and upgrade it to windows 10.
I'm just a casual gamer that likes to play League of legends from time to time with my friends but for some reason despite getting high 140 fps on the game, my screen will randomly freeze from time to time for 0.5 - 2 seconds.
--
My specs are:
GeForce GTX 860M
Intel Core i7-4710HQ CPU @ 2.50GHz
8GB Ram
--
Yes it is not the best of specs but surely it should be more than capable enough to handle LoL without the freezes correct?
I've tried defragging, updating my drivers, scanning for viruses, etc but nothing seems to fix it.

replies.body: When the freezing happens, are you not able to alt+tab out of the application or move your mouse? Do the symptoms look more like champs/minions freezing while still being able to move around the camera or interact with the UI? A few more details will help me understand exactly what's going on.

Thank you for your time. When the freezes occur, everything but the audio freezes, the characters, mouse, unable to interact with UI, move camera, etc. I haven't tried alt+tabbing during a freeze but I will definitely attempt it.
When the game unfreezes, the game doesn't go to the current time by speeding up from where my screen initially froze (which may mean it's a latency issue). Instead, after unfreezing, the game just jumps to the current time as if everything played out normally and I was the only one that froze.

Gotcha. In this case, it seems that your freezing is more than likely caused by a bad system driver interaction or an issue with your hardware. I strongly suggest working through our [**Bugsplat & Crash Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) to address the most common culprits for the systems you're experiencing.

Let me know if this caused any noticeable change in your symptoms.

Sweet I've did everything on that link and it seems to have drastically reduced the freeze time! I still get a very minor jitter when I first play on this computer and it introduces a new action (For example the first blood, or first dragon kill will cause the game to freeze a bit).

Btw, I don't know if this has to do with the issue but for some reason, when I check LoL on the Programs and Features tab on my PC, it always changes the date as if I re-installed the game. http://imgur.com/a/mADsU Here's a screenshot of what I mean.

So in the screenshot it says I installed league on the 21st, but I installed it months ago. It's been constantly changing the dates so when I check it on the 22nd, it will undoubtedly say LoL was installed on 22nd. Do you know why this is happening? Thanks!

That's really interesting! It's possible that your remaining jitters and installation date behavior are tied to League missing assets or having to repair corrupt assets all the time. I'd like you to run system logs with our [**HRT App**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so one of our tech specialists can work with you on troubleshooting these issues further.

Let me know if you run into any issues.

I'd cap your frame rates at 30 or 60 (or 59? is that an option).

You don't need uncapped on a laptop it will cause it to overheat/wear out quickly.
I tried to a cap the frames and it seemed to have fixed it at first, but the problem occurred. I think may need to pull apart the laptop and clean out all the dusts inside.
No problem. Also, when you do, think about looking at your heatsink. The thermal compound is usually only good for 6 months in ones that are used for gaming.
Ah yes my laptop definitely is in need of some new thermal paste, thank you!
